title: How to Change Default Apps on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Download an email or browser app from the App Store.
steps.content: Download an email or browser app from the App Store. For example, if you want to switch your default email app to Outlook, you'll need to download Outlook from the app store. [1] X Research source If you haven't yet updated your iPhone or iPad to iOS/iPadOS 14 or later, see How to Update your iPhone first. Some browsers and email apps cannot be set as default apps. This is just because the developers of those apps haven't updated the app with this feature. Some popular apps that can be set as default for email are Spark, Outlook, and Gmail. Popular replacement browsers are Chrome and Firefox.

steps.title: Tap the gear icon on your home screen.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon on your home screen. If you don't see it there, it'll be in the App Library's Utilities category.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap your new browser or mail app.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap your new browser or mail app. For example, if you want Chrome to be your default browser, scroll down and tap Chrome .

steps.title: It's near the middle of the page.
steps.content: It's near the middle of the page. You'll see a list of appsâ€”the app with a blue checkmark is the one that's set as default. If you don't see this option, the app cannot be chosen as the default. Since the feature is new, you may just have to wait a bit for the app to update.

steps.title: Choose the app you want your iPhone or iPad to open when you do something that requires a browser or email message.
steps.content: Choose the app you want your iPhone or iPad to open when you do something that requires a browser or email message. The blue checkmark will move to your new default app.
